GlyphCache * cache_

Detailed Description

This class can be queried for font based information, including character width, string width and height.

All values are returned in texels, unless otherwise specified.

Member Function Documentation

std::vector< std::wstring > FontMetrics::breakString ( std::wstring  wstr,
int &  w,
int &  h,
int  minHyphenWidth = 0,
const std::wstring &  wordBreak = L" ",
const std::wstring &  punctuation = L",<.>/?;:'\"[{]}\\|`~!@#$%^&*()-_=+" 
)

This method breaks a string into a segments for display within a specified width and height.

This method accepts a long string and the max width, and returns the result width & height ( in texels ) of the given string and the broken string lines.

Parameters:
wstr The string to break.
w The desired max width.
h The desired max height.
wordBreak The chars that could be used as seperator of word.
punctuation The chars work as punctuations.
minHyphenWidth If the width of the rest of line is <= minHyphenWidth, we will use hyphen to break word
Returns:
std::vector<std::string> Broken string lines.

const GlyphCache& FontMetrics::cache (  )  const [inline]

GlyphCache& FontMetrics::cache (  )  [inline]

float FontMetrics::clipHeight (  )  const

This method returns the height of the font, in clip coordinates.

It is calculated each time, because texel->clip can change.

Returns:
float The height of the font, in clip coordinates.

float FontMetrics::clipWidth ( wchar_t  c  ) 

This method returns the width of a character, in clip coordinates.

It is calculated each time, because texel->clip can change.

Parameters:
c The character for the uv width calculation.
Returns:
float The width of c, in clip coordinates.

float FontMetrics::heightPixels (  )  const

This method returns the height of the font.

It is assumed all characters in the font set have the same height.

Returns:
float The height of the font.

float FontMetrics::maxWidth (  )  const

This method returns the width of the widest character, in texels.

Returns:
float Width in texels of the widest character in the font.

int &  w,
int &  h,
bool  multiline = false,

)

This method returns the width and height of a string, in texels.

Parameters:
str The string for dimension calculation.
w The returned width
h The returned height
bool Whether or not newline characters should be wrapped.
bool Whether or not colour formatting tags should be parsed.
